summary: The Women Veterans Cancer Care Coordination Act aims to improve breast and gynecologic cancer care for women veterans. It mandates the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) to establish regional Care Coordinators within a year of enactment. These coordinators are responsible for care coordination between VA and community providers, monitoring veteran outcomes, providing information, and documenting care. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a report within three years analyzing health outcomes, timeliness, and safety of care, and evaluating improvements needed.
